sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम | अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ||1||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
kiṁ tad brahma kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣhottama
adhibhūtaṁ cha kiṁ proktam adhidaivaṁ kim uchyate
translation: Arjuna said: O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the self? What is karma? What is said to be the material manifestation, and what are the demigods?

sanskrit: अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन | प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः ||2||
transliteration:
adhiyajñaḥ kathaṁ ko ’tra dehe ’smin madhusūdana
prayāṇa-kāle cha kathaṁ jñeyo ’si niyatātmabhiḥ
translation: Who is the Lord of sacrifice, and how does He dwell in the body, O Madhusudana? And how can those of steadfast mind know You at the time of death?

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते | भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः ||3||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
akṣharaṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo ’dhyātmam uchyate
bhūta-bhāvodbhava-karo visargaḥ karma-saṁjñitaḥ
translation: The Blessed Lord said: The imperishable is Brahman; one's own nature is called adhyatma. The offering that causes the origin of beings is called karma.

sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् | अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ||4||
transliteration:
adhibhūtaṁ kṣharo bhāvaḥ puruṣhaśh chādhidaivatam
adhiyajño ’ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛitāṁ vara
translation: The physical manifestation is called adhibhuta, the cosmic form is adhidaiva, and I, the Supreme Lord, am adhiyajna, the Lord of sacrifice, dwelling in the body.

sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् | यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ||5||
transliteration:
anta-kāle cha mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaram
yaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṁ yāti nāsty atra sanśhayaḥ
translation: Whoever at the time of death remembers Me alone, leaves the body and attains My nature. Of this, there is no doubt.

sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् | तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ||6||
transliteration:
yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajaty ante kalevaram
taṁ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ
translation: Whatever one remembers at the time of death, O son of Kunti, that state he will attain, being always absorbed in such contemplation.

sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च | मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम् ||7||
transliteration:
tasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu mām anusmara yudhya cha
mayy arpita-mano-buddhir mām evaiṣhyasy asaṁśhayaḥ
translation: Therefore, always remember Me and also do your duty of fighting. With your mind and intellect surrendered to Me, you will definitely attain Me; of this, there is no doubt.

sanskrit: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना | परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ||8||
transliteration:
abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena chetasā nānya-gāminā
paramaṁ puruṣhaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānuchintayan
translation: With a mind trained in the practice of meditation and not deviating to anything else, one attains the Supreme Divine Person by constant remembrance.

sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः | सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ||9||
transliteration:
kaviṁ purāṇam anuśhāsitāram aṇor aṇīyāṁsam anusmared yaḥ
sarvasya dhātāram achintya-rūpam āditya-varṇaṁ tamasaḥ parastāt
translation: One should meditate upon the Supreme Person as the one who knows everything, who is the oldest, the controller, smaller than the smallest, the sustainer of all, beyond material conception, and who is luminous like the sun and beyond all darkness.

sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाऽचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव | भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ||10||
transliteration:
prayāṇa-kāle manasā ’chalena bhaktyā yukto yoga-balena chaiva
bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśhya samyak sa taṁ paraṁ puruṣham upaiti divyam
translation: At the time of death, with a steady mind, full of devotion, and by the power of yoga, fixing the life force between the eyebrows, one attains the Supreme Divine Person.

sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः | यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ||11||
transliteration:
yad akṣharaṁ veda-vido vadanti viśhanti yad yatayo vīta-rāgāḥ
yad ichchhanto brahma-charyaṁ charanti tat te padaṁ saṅgraheṇa pravakṣhye
translation: That which the knowers of the Vedas describe as imperishable, which the ascetics enter free from desire, and for which they practice celibacy—I shall now explain that goal to you briefly.

sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च | मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ||12||
transliteration:
sarva-dvārāṇi saṁyamya mano hṛidi nirudhya cha
mūrdhny ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām
translation: Controlling all the gates of the body, fixing the mind in the heart, and drawing the life force to the head, one should engage in firm yogic concentration.

sanskrit: ओं इत्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् | यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ||13||
transliteration:
oṁ ity ekākṣharaṁ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran
yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṁ sa yāti paramāṁ gatim
translation: Uttering the single syllable 'Om', which is Brahman, and remembering Me, one who leaves the body attains the supreme goal.

sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः | तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ||14||
transliteration:
ananya-chetāḥ satataṁ yo māṁ smarati nityaśhaḥ
tasyāhaṁ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ
translation: O Partha, for one who remembers Me constantly with undivided attention, I am easily attainable because of his constant devotion.

sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् | नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ||15||
transliteration:
mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśhāśhvatam
nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṁsiddhiṁ paramāṁ gatāḥ
translation: Having attained Me, the great souls do not take birth again in this temporary world, which is full of miseries, because they have attained the highest perfection.

sanskrit: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन | मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ||16||
transliteration:
ā-brahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino ’rjuna
mām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate
translation: All planets in the material world, including Brahma’s abode, are places of repeated birth and death. But one who attains Me, O son of Kunti, never takes birth again.

sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः | रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ||17||
transliteration:
sahasra-yuga-paryantam ahar yad brahmaṇo viduḥ
rātriṁ yuga-sahasrāntāṁ te ’ho-rātra-vido janāḥ
translation: Those who understand the length of Brahma’s day, which lasts a thousand yugas, and his night, which also lasts a thousand yugas, truly know day and night.

sanskrit: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे | रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ||18||
transliteration:
avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavanty ahar-āgame
rātry-āgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-saṁjñake
translation: At the beginning of Brahma’s day, all living beings come into being from the unmanifest, and at the arrival of his night, they are annihilated into the same unmanifest.

sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते | रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ||19||
transliteration:
bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṁ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate
rātry-āgame ’vaśhaḥ pārtha prabhavaty ahar-āgame
translation: Again and again, the same multitude of beings is born and annihilated at the arrival of day and night, helplessly, O Partha.

sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः | यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ||20||
transliteration:
paras tasmāt tu bhāvo ’nyo ’vyakto ’vyaktāt sanātanaḥ
yaḥ sa sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu naśhyatsu na vinaśhyati
translation: Yet there is another unmanifest nature, eternal and beyond this visible and invisible world, which is never destroyed even when all beings perish.

sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् | यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||21||
transliteration:
avyakto ’kṣhara ity uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṁ gatim
yaṁ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama
translation: That unmanifest is called the imperishable, and it is said to be the ultimate goal. Those who reach it never return. That is My supreme abode.

sanskrit: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया | यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ||22||
transliteration:
puruṣhaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tv ananyayā
yasyāntaḥ-sthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
translation: That Supreme Person, O Partha, is attainable only by exclusive devotion. Although He is all-pervading and present in all beings, He can be known only through devotion.

sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः | प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ||23||
transliteration:
yatra kāle tv anāvṛittim āvṛittiṁ chaiva yoginaḥ
prayātā yānti taṁ kālaṁ vakṣhyāmi bharatarṣhabha
translation: O best of the Bharatas, I shall now explain the times at which yogis depart from this world, either never to return or to return again.

sanskrit: अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् | तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ||24||
transliteration:
agniḥ jyotir ahaḥ śhuklaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇam
tatra prayātā gachchhanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ
translation: Those who know the Supreme Brahman and depart during the time of fire, light, the bright fortnight, and the six months of the northern solstice go to Brahman.

sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् | तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ||25||
transliteration:
dhūmo rātris tathā kṛiṣhṇaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā dakṣiṇāyanam
tatra chāndramasaṁ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartate
translation: Those who depart during the time of smoke, night, the dark fortnight, and the six months of the southern solstice reach the lunar light and return again.

sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते | एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ||26||
transliteration:
śhukla-kṛiṣhṇe gatī hy ete jagataḥ śhāśhvate mate
ekayā yāty anāvṛittim anyayāvartate punaḥ
translation: These two paths—light and dark—are considered eternal. One leads to liberation and the other leads to rebirth.

sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन | तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ||27||
transliteration:
naite sṛitī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaśchana
tasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna
translation: O Partha, the yogi who knows these two paths is never bewildered. Therefore, be steadfast in yoga at all times.

sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् | अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ||28||
transliteration:
vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu chaiva dāneṣu yat puṇya-phalaṁ pradiṣṭam
atyeti tat sarvam idaṁ viditvā yogī paraṁ sthānam upaiti chādyam
translation: Knowing all this, the yogi transcends the fruits of Vedic study, sacrifices, austerities, and charity, and attains the supreme, original abode.
